title: Iceland holidays are going from £192pp with flights in December but be quick
text:

Iceland has everything you could want for a dreamy winter break.

It's one of the best countries for seeing the Northern Lights , it's got some breathtaking snowy landscapes, and there are heaps of activities ranging from exploring ice caves to hiking along the spectacular glaciers.

However, because winter is one of the best times to visit Iceland, prices can often hike up during the colder months - but thanks to a new offer, it's possible to visit if you're on a budget this December!

That's because LoveHolidays currently has a deal on two-night breaks from £192pp, staying at the 4* Grand Hotel Reykjavik on a room-only basis. (A savin of £122pp compared to the usual package price).

The best part is the deal also includes your return flights, based on a 9th December departure from London Luton.

You can already book the deal on LoveHolidays but it's worth noting that the lowest fares are subject to availability.

(Image: Lonely Planet Images)

It is worth being aware that because the flights are with Wizz Air, you'll need to pay if you want to bring a second bag.

The airline's hand luggage policy allows one free bag per passenger weighing no more than 10kg and with maximum dimensions of 40 x 30 x 20 cm, so if you want a second bag you'll need to pay extra or upgrade to priority boarding.

You can find out more on the Wizz Air website .

(Image: SWNS-Cambridge-+44 (0)1179066550)

The flight time is about three hours so there'll be ample opportunity to pack heaps of adventures into your break.

If sightseeing is top of the list then iconic landmarks such as the Harpa Concert Hall, National Museum of Iceland and Sun Voyager sculpture need to be on your radar.

Want to see the Northern Lights? There are heaps of excursions and Aurora safaris to be found - and make sure to check out this photographer's top tips for getting that dream shot!

Meanwhile the city offers up heaps of restaurants where you can sample the delicious local cuisine, as well as vibrant bars if you fancy a post-dinner tipple.
description: Iceland is a brilliant winter holiday destination and this December you don't need to break the bank to visit
